contenido.en:
Many people imagine the final judgment as a catastrophic day in which God punishes most of humanity. However, the Bible reveals it will be a time of hope, learning, and restorative justice. This judgment will take place under Christâ€™s Kingdom for a thousand years, with the goal of educating, restoring, and granting eternal life to those who accept God's will.

ğŸ”¹ When and how will the final judgment occur?
It is not one literal day but a thousand-year period after Armageddon. Jesus and the 144,000 will reign in justice (Revelation 20:4). 'The scrolls' will be opened (Revelation 20:12), providing divine guidance for the resurrected.

ğŸ”¹ Who will be judged?
There will be a resurrection of both the righteous and unrighteous (John 5:28-29; Acts 24:15). Many who never knew Jehovah will be educated. Each person will be judged based on their actions during that time (Isaiah 26:9).

ğŸ”¹ What role does Jesus play?
God will judge through Jesus (Acts 17:31). He understands human weakness and will judge with mercy (Isaiah 11:4).

ğŸ”¹ Punishment or restoration?
The judgment aims to restore humanity to Eden-like perfection (1 Corinthians 15:22-25). Isaiah 65:20 shows that even sinners will have time to correct their course, though persistent wrongdoers will face consequences.

The final judgment is not a day of massive punishment but a fair, restorative period. Millions will receive education, guidance, and the opportunity to live forever.
